body_content.explanation: (of a gun) holding only one bullet or other piece of ammunition so that it has to be loaded again after every time it is used:
examples: He claimed the single-shot pistol was an antique.
A single-shot hunting rifle was propped against the wall.

body_content.explanation: (of a film or part of a film) made in one continuous shot (= a short piece in which there is a single action or a short series of actions):
examples: Hitchcock's single-shot movie "Rope" is one of his best technical achievements.
One of Sokurov's best-known films is "Russian Ark", a single-shot tour of St Petersburg's Hermitage Museum.

body_content.explanation: (of a drug) given as one injection (= the act of putting a liquid drug into someone's body using a needle and small tube) rather than two or more injections:
examples: The original vaccine required six injections over several months, but researchers have now developed a single-shot vaccine.
A variety of needles are used for single-shot epidurals.

body_content.explanation: (of a drink) made with only one shot (= small amount) of alcoholic drink or espresso (= strong coffee):
examples: A typical single-shot cocktail contains about 15 grams of alcohol.
